The group’s scientists presented its results at the 33rd Biennial of the Biotechnology Industry Association (BIA) in Geneva on March 18.After examining more than 8,500 chemicals, the scientists concluded that androgenic steroids—which include testosterone, the primary androgen, as well as growth hormone and growth hormone analogues—cause cancer in laboratory animals.
